Member Function Documentation

virtual USocket* UTCPSocket::acceptClient (  )  [inline, virtual]

This method is called to accept a new connection on the server socket. Further communications on the newly connected socket are made via the newly created USocket instance of which a pointer is returned when the connection is accepted. We create a USocket instance and pass this to the base class accept() method to accept the pending connection on this USocket instance

Reimplemented from USocket.

Reimplemented in USSLSocket.

virtual USocket* UTCPSocket::acceptClient ( USocket *  pcNewConnection  )  [inline, virtual]

This method is called to accept a new connection on the server socket. Further communications on the newly connected socket are made via the newly created UTCPSocket instance of which a pointer is returned when the connection is accepted. We create a UTCPSocket instance and pass this to the base class accept() method to accept the pending connection on this UTCPSocket instance.

Reimplemented from USocket.

Reimplemented in USSLSocket.

virtual bool UTCPSocket::connectServer ( const UString &  server,
int  iServPort 
) [inline, virtual]

This method is called to connect the socket to a server TCP socket that is specified by the provided IP Address and port number. We call the connect() method to perform the connection.

Reimplemented from USocket.

Reimplemented in USSHSocket, and USSLSocket.

virtual bool UTCPSocket::setServer ( int  port,
int  iBackLog 
) [inline, virtual]

We try to bind the USocket to the specified port number and any local IP Address using the bind() method.

Reimplemented from USocket.
